availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
Assistant Adjutant General's Office,
DEPARTMENT OF THE OHIO,
Lexington, Kentucky, January 8th, 1864.

SPECIAL ORDERS,
No 9 } 3,, ,, ,, The resignation of 1st Lieut James H. Loh. Co "B" 45th Kentucky Mounted Inf, is for the good of the serivce hereby accepted to take effect on the (9th) ninth day of January 1864, He to receive no final payment until he exhibits satisfactory evidence from the Head of the Ordnance Department, and the proper accounting officer of the Treasury, that he has made all prescribed returns and is in no wise indebted to the United States on account of Ordnance.

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL FOSTER.
R. Morrow
Assistant Adjutant General.
1. 2. 3. 4. 5
Septr 1. 1863
Gov. of Ky.

45 Infy
Lieut Loh
Resigs
Filed Jany 124: 1864
